meanings.definition: Possessed by a single idea or obsession.
meanings.sent1: Her monomaniacal focus on winning the game made her practice tirelessly.
meanings.sent2: The detective's monomaniacal pursuit of the criminal led to his capture.
meanings.sent3: His monomaniacal love for pizza was evident by the stacks of pizza boxes in his room.
meanings.sent4: The artist's monomaniacal dedication to perfection transformed his work into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The monomaniacal scientist spent years researching a single theory, never wavering in his belief.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an excessive focus on one particular thing.
meanings.sent1: The monomaniacal student only cared about getting the highest grades in class.
meanings.sent2: Her monomaniacal attention to detail ensured that every project she worked on was flawless.
meanings.sent3: The monomaniacal gardener spent hours tending to his prized rose garden.
meanings.sent4: The monomaniacal chef obsessed over creating the perfect dish, experimenting with flavors endlessly.
meanings.sent5: His monomaniacal dedication to his craft made him a master in his field.

meanings.definition: Showing an extreme preoccupation with a single subject.
meanings.sent1: The monomaniacal fan knew every detail about his favorite band, from their first album to their latest tour.
meanings.sent2: Her monomaniacal interest in astronomy led her to spend nights stargazing and studying the cosmos.
meanings.sent3: The monomaniacal bookworm could spend hours lost in a single novel, oblivious to the world around him.
meanings.sent4: The monomaniacal athlete focused solely on improving his performance, training rigorously every day.
meanings.sent5: His monomaniacal dedication to his research project impressed his professors and peers alike.
